alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 14 at 3:30AM AKST until December 14 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING FOR WHITTIER... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions due to blowing snow expected. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Visibility reduced to as low as one quarter mile with whiteout conditions possible at times. * WHERE...Whittier. * WHEN...From 9 AM this morning to 6 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and result in significant drifting of snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Westerly winds in and around Whittier will quickly increase this morning in the wake of several rounds of heavy snow. The strong winds will lift easily transportable snow already on the ground leading to ground blizzard conditions. Winds are expected to peak in intensity between noon and 6 pm before diminishing Thursday night.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
